1. Creates a host security group with the specified list of initiators (host ports) and with the given name.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>create</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>create-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <storagesystem-id>1159</storagesystem-id> <hostport-ids>1003 1004</hostport-ids> <name>"New Name"</name> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. storagesystem-id[Required] Identifier for the storagesystem. hostport-ids[Required] List of host ports (initiators). You can use either the port ID or its 16-digit world wide name (WWN). name[Optional] The name you specify for the host security group.
2. Creates a host security group with the given name that is associated with the specified lists of initiators (host ports) and storage system ports.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>create</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>create-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <storagesystem-id>1159</storagesystem-id> <storagesystemport-ids>1001 1002</storagesystemport-ids> <hostport-ids>1003 1004</hostport-ids> <name>"New Name"</name> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. storagesystem-id[Required] Identifier for the storagesystem. storagesystemport-ids[Required] List of storage system port IDs. IDs should be separated by spaces. hostport-ids[Required] List of host ports (initiators). You can use either the port ID or its 16-digit world wide name (WWN). name[Optional] The name you specify for the host security group.
3. Creates a host security group with a given name that is associated with the specified lists of initiators (host ports), storage system ports, and volumes. Device access specifies access level to each of the specified storage volume.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>create</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>create-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <storagesystem-id>1159</storagesystem-id> <storagesystemport-ids>1001 1002</storagesystemport-ids> <hostport-ids>1003 1004</hostport-ids> <volume-ids>1005 1006</volume-ids> <deviceaccess-ids>0 2</deviceaccess-ids> <name>"New Name"</name> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. storagesystem-id[Required] Identifier for the storagesystem. storagesystemport-ids[Required] List of storage system port IDs. IDs should be separated by spaces. hostport-ids[Required] List of host ports (initiators). You can use either the port ID or its 16-digit world wide name (WWN). volume-ids[Required] List of storage system volume IDs. deviceaccess-ids[Required] List of volume access rights for each volume specified by list of volume-ids. For each volume specified, you must provide one of the following numbers to indicate the access type: 0: Unknown access, 2: Read-write, 3: Read-only, 4: No access name[Optional] The name you specify for the host security group.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Creates a host security group with the specified list of initiators (host ports) and with the given name. 2. Creates a host security group with the given name that is associated with the specified lists of initiators (host ports) and storage system ports. 3. Creates a host security group with a given name that is associated with the specified lists of initiators (host ports), storage system ports, and volumes. Device access specifies access level to each of the specified storage volume.
